definition: ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)

sentences.english: And Ezra blessed the LORD, the great God.
sentences.chinese: 以斯拉稱頌耶和華至大的神。

sentences.english: Everything that exalts life at the same time increases its absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 每件稱頌生命的事物同時也增加了生命的荒謬。

sentences.english: All worshiping and praising the eternal God.
sentences.chinese: 都一同敬拜稱頌永生真神。

sentences.english: 18 it is we who extol the Lord , both now and forevermore.
sentences.chinese: 但我們要稱頌耶和華，從今時直到永遠。

sentences.english: According to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.
sentences.chinese: 這是照着可稱頌之神交託我榮耀福音說的。

sentences.english: Sing to the Lord , praise his name; proclaim his salvation day after day.
sentences.chinese: 要向耶和華歌唱，稱頌他的名，天天傳揚他的救恩。
他高尚的行爲值得稱頌。

sentences.english: Praise be to the Lord , the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華以色列的神，是應當稱頌的，從亙古直到永遠。

sentences.english: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for evermore.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華的名，是應當稱頌的，從今時直到永遠。

sentences.english: Praise be to the Lord , the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華以色列的神，從亙古直到永遠，是應當稱頌的。

sentences.english: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華以色列的神，是應當稱頌的，從亙古直到永遠。

sentences.english: He complimented her on her new dress without even looking at it.
sentences.chinese: 他連看都沒看一眼，就稱頌她的新衣服。

sentences.english: Blessed to open the last dispensation, Kings shall extol him, and nations revere.
sentences.chinese: 衆神祝福最後福音期開啓，萬王稱頌全民內心敬重。

sentences.english: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.
sentences.chinese: 那永遠可稱頌之主耶穌的父神，知道我不說謊。

sentences.english: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華以色列的神，從亙古直到永遠，是應當稱頌的。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
great calligraphy master/the Sage of Calligraphy, traditional reference to Wang Xizhi 王羲之[Wang2 Xi1 zhi1] (303-361)
to acclaim/to sing the praises of
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
